trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Tui-Shirr could use some assistance with repair work.
TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the lumber and ring to Tui-Shirr.
TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_000<tab>Are you busy? If not, I would greatly appreciate some help with repairing this shed─it's something of a mess, at the moment.

TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_001<tab>I'm low on lumber, but it'll take ages to get the work done if I have to stop and hunt down more materials. Can you bring me four solid-looking planks, for the time being? Some of the wood from the old sunken ships ought to still be fit for use.
TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_002<tab>You're looking for wood that's not too waterlogged or splintered. Doesn't have to look appealing, as long as it's sturdy.

TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_SYSTEM_000_010<tab>You notice a glittering object wedged in the crevice between two boards. Extracting it from its hiding place, you see that it's a ring─one that has fared rather poorly in the elements. Perhaps Tui-Shirr will know to whom it belongs.
TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_022<tab>Oh, this is a customs ring! They used to serve as authorization for traders to enter Eulmore.
TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_023<tab>How do I know? Well, I used to work in the shipyard, as a matter of fact. Read a lot about its history at the time.

TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_024<tab>Someday, I'd like to rebuild one of those old ships─make it fit to sail the world on grand adventures once again. It's a far cry from stripping the same vessels for shed materials, but a man can dream.

TEXT_LUCKZH013_03523_TUISHIRR_000_025<tab>I'll give you a portion of my pay for this job as thanks for your help. I thought about splitting my lunch with you instead, but the money is probably more portable. And considerably less ripe, at this point.
